availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Phillip S. Beswick (Boyle County, Kentucky, farmer)

body.p: Boyle County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of Elizabeth Beswick. Farmer in Boyle County in 1850. Enlisted as a private in the 6th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (C.S.A.) on August 10, 1862.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Boyle, District 1, p. 340B.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky: Confederate Kentucky Volunteers War 1861-65, vol. 1 (Frankfort: Legislature of Kentucky, 1915), 672.
